meanings.definition: To claim or seize without justification
meanings.sent1: The bully tried to arrogate my lunch money by force.
meanings.sent2: He arrogated the credit for her hard work on the project.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel arrogated all the nuts in the park, leaving none for the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The dictator arrogated power to himself, ruling with an iron fist.
meanings.sent5: She arrogated the title of 'best chef' after winning the cooking competition.

meanings.definition: To claim or seize without right
meanings.sent1: The thief arrogated the jewels from the museum display.
meanings.sent2: The company tried to arrogate ownership of the idea from its creator.
meanings.sent3: The cat arrogated the comfiest spot on the couch, leaving no room for anyone else.
meanings.sent4: The storm arrogated the landscape, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: He arrogated the last piece of cake without asking anyone else.

meanings.definition: To claim or seize without authority
meanings.sent1: The student arrogated the teacher's role, trying to control the class.
meanings.sent2: The impostor arrogated the identity of the missing prince.
meanings.sent3: The toddler arrogated the role of the parent, telling everyone what to do.
meanings.sent4: The virus arrogated control of the computer system, causing chaos.
meanings.sent5: The rival company arrogated the top clients, leaving the business struggling.
